hedline.hl1: France via Britain For Hungry Americans

abstract.p: Sinclair Beecham and Julian Metcalfe open Pret a Manger, chain restaurant, on Broad Street (New Yorkers & Co column) (S)

block.p: Though the name is French for ''ready to eat,'' the founders of Pret a Manger -- Sinclair Beecham and Julian Metcalfe -- are British, and the chain's more than 100 locations are in the United Kingdom and Scotland. Until this summer, that is, when the company started serving New York's financial district its menu of fresh sandwiches ($2 to $5), baguettes ($3.75 to $4.50) and wraps ($4.25-$4.75).

Though the name is French for ''ready to eat,'' the founders of Pret a Manger -- Sinclair Beecham and Julian Metcalfe -- are British, and the chain's more than 100 locations are in the United Kingdom and Scotland. Until this summer, that is, when the company started serving New York's financial district its menu of fresh sandwiches ($2 to $5), baguettes ($3.75 to $4.50) and wraps ($4.25-$4.75).
At 60 Broad Street (Exchange Street), the shop has a staff that prepares the food daily by hand, avoiding additives and preservatives.
